meanings.definition: The ability to sense mechanical stimuli, such as pressure or vibration.
meanings.sent1: Her mechanoreceptions allowed her to feel the gentle touch of a butterfly on her skin.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study mechanoreceptions to understand how our bodies respond to different pressures.
meanings.sent3: The robot's advanced mechanoreceptions made it the best masseuse in town.
meanings.sent4: His mechanoreceptions were so finely tuned, he could sense a change in the air before a storm.
meanings.sent5: The superhero's mechanoreceptions were so acute, she could detect danger before it even approached.

meanings.definition: The process by which mechanical stimuli are detected and converted into neural signals.
meanings.sent1: Mechanoreceptions play a crucial role in transmitting touch sensations to the brain.
meanings.sent2: Scientists are still researching the intricacies of mechanoreceptions in the nervous system.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy robot's mechanoreceptions often got confused and sent wrong signals to its brain.
meanings.sent4: Her mechanoreceptions were like antennas, picking up every tiny movement around her.
meanings.sent5: The mechanoreceptions of the machine were so precise, they could detect a single grain of sand on its surface.

meanings.definition: The sensory receptors responsible for detecting mechanical stimuli in the environment.
meanings.sent1: The mechanoreceptions in our fingertips help us feel textures and shapes.
meanings.sent2: Animals rely on their mechanoreceptions to navigate their surroundings and find food.
meanings.sent3: The alien's mechanoreceptions were so sensitive, it could hear a pin drop on another planet.
meanings.sent4: His mechanoreceptions were like tiny detectives, always on the lookout for any movement.
meanings.sent5: The robot's mechanoreceptions were so advanced, it could distinguish between different types of metals just by touching them.
